title: Linux groupdel Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux groupdel command and learn how to delete groups effectively. This lab covers the purpose of groupdel, creating test groups, and deleting groups using practical examples.

meta.title: Linux groupdel Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux groupdel command and learn how to delete groups effectively. This lab covers the purpose of groupdel, creating test groups, and deleting groups using practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, groupdel, user management, permission management, group deletion, command line

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the groupdel Command

verify.name: Verify the testgroup was deleted
verify.hint: The `testgroup` should have been deleted from the system. Please check the `/etc/group` file to ensure the group no longer exists.

verify.name: Verify the test groups were created
verify.hint: The test groups `group1`, `group2`, and `group3` should have been created successfully. Please check the `/etc/group` file to ensure all three groups exist.

steps.title: Delete Groups Using the groupdel Command

verify.name: Verify the groups were deleted
verify.hint: The `group1` and `group2` groups should have been deleted from the system. Please check the `/etc/group` file to ensure these groups no longer exist.
